text: Server Logging - in Database or Logfile?
I've been working on a server and I'm starting to implement logging.
However, I'm not sure whether I should use the db for logging, or just a plaintext file.
I'm planning on logging some basic information for every request (what type of request, ip address of request, session tracking).
For some requests there will be extended information present (details on what type of request was made), and if there are any errors I will log those, too.
On the one hand, putting the logs into the db means I could run queries on the logged data.
On the other hand, I'm not sure if this would be putting unnecessary strain on the db.
Of course, I could also use both the db and a log file for logging.
What are people's thoughts on proper logging?
(If it makes a difference, I'm using mod_python on an Apache server with a MySQL db.
So I'd either be using the logging library or just creating some logging tables in the db.
